TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlace>
Public Class FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection Inherits Collection(Of FileDialogCustomPlace)

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of Windows Vista custom places for the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks On [!INCLUDE[winxp](~/includes/winxp-md.md)] or [!INCLUDE[winxpsvr](~/includes/winxpsvr-md.md)], this class does not have any effect.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection>. To run this example, paste the following code into a Windows Form and call `InitializeDialogAndButton` from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces/CS/Form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces/VB/Form1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Adds a custom place to the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(valuetype System.Guid knownFolderGuid) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents a [!INCLUDE[wiprlhext](~/includes/wiprlhext-md.md)] Known Folder.
Docs.summary: Adds a custom place to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The folder is added to custom places only for a particular <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog> and is not a system or application wide change.
The folders are positioned in the custom places in the order that they are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog>. The last one added will be at the top. If you add a custom place to the collection that does not exist on the computer running the application, the custom place will not be shown. GUIDs are case-insensitive. For a list of the available [!INCLUDE[wiprlhext](~/includes/wiprlhext-md.md)] Known Folders, see [Known Folder GUIDs for File Dialog Custom Places](/dotnet/framework/winforms/controls/known-folder-guids-for-file-dialog-custom-places) or the KnownFolders.h file in the Windows SDK.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCustomPlacesCollection.Add%2A> method. To run this example, paste the following code into a Windows Form and call `InitializeDialogAndButton` from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces/CS/Form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.FileDialogCommonPlaces/VB/Form1.vb#1)]

Docs.related: Known Folder Guids for File Dialog Custom Places

The folders are positioned in the custom places in the order that they are added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FileDialog>. The last one added will be at the top.
